intro: Polycarpaea indica var. obtusiflora, commonly known as the Indian polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
